title: Iconic DMZ Korea Tour To Explore Korean Turbulent Historic Myths (kims travel)
text: By kims travel Oct 23, 2015 If you are a traveler and looking for the iconic historic attractions to discover during your upcoming holiday vacation, then it's not quite surprising that you might not think about South Korea. The truth is that there is a wide array of sightseeing sites in South Korea that worths a visit. Well, South Korea is rich in culture, art, food, nature, history and incredible beauty of the nature. Apart from this, DMZ (Demilitarized Zone) is the important representations of the Koreans.Demilitarized Zone or DMZExtending around 250km across the Korean Peninsula, the Demilitarized Zone of Korea separates South Korea from North Korea. DMZ is nothing but most notorious and long standing war areas throughout the world. It's strange though it may seem, the Korean Demilitarized Zone is something that stands out as a tourist hotspot which draws thousands curious eyes year round. Among all the heavily militarized places throughout the world, the uniqueness of DMZ Korea has made itself the most popular destination for foreign visitors. The interesting fact is that this DMZ attraction is located within 90 minutes from the South Korean Capital city, Seoul.Planning for a DMZ Korea Tour..On DMZ Korea tour from Seoul, you will be able to feel the reality of Korean turbulent history and will able to understand the line which divides North Korea and South Korea better. You should travel by the reliable, well-known tour specialist for DMZ Korea tour and learn the fascinating history about the role of this zone in the Cold War and Korean War. There is an availability of so many places that you should visit during your DMZ tour in Korea. So, you should include the Freedom Bridge, the 3rd Infiltration Tunnel and Dora Observatory to your visit list.Top 3 Most Famous DMZ Sites To Explore on Korea TourFreedom BridgeLocated at 2 kilometers north of Munsan, Freedom Bridge is the one and only path; that connects both South Korea and North Korea through Imjin River. It was originally built as the Kyung-eu Railway Bridge and again reconstructed to the Freedom Bridge after that.The 3rd Infiltration TunnelThis Third Infiltration Tunnel was discovered in October, 1978. The tunnel is of 1.95 meter height, 2.1 meters width and 1,635 meters length. Usually, it goes in 435 meters south of the military demarcation line and finishes at the Truce Village of Panmunjeom.Dora-ObservatoryBased on the top of Dorasan, the Observatory appears across the Demilitarized Zone. In short, it's the part of South Korea being closer to the North Korea. Here, the visitors can able to get a rare glimpse of the North Korean State through the binoculars from the 304 square feet and this observatory has the capacity of accommodating 500 people.
